text: The Forester's Daughter () is a 1952 West German musical comedy film directed by Arthur Maria Rabenalt and starring Johanna Matz, Karl Schönböck and Will Quadflieg.Bock & Bergfelder, p. 336 It is based on the 1907 operetta Die Försterchristl, which is set in the Austrian Empire during Franz Josef's reign. The film is part of the operetta film subgenre. It was shot at the Bavaria Studios in Munich and on location around Bad Tölz. The film's sets were designed by Robert Herlth. ==Cast== == References == == Bibliography == * == External links == * Category:1952 films Category:1950s historical musical films Category:German historical musical films Category:West German films Category:German-language films Category:Films directed by Arthur Maria Rabenalt Category:Films set in Austria Category:Films set in the 1850s Category:Operetta films Category:Films based on operettas Category:Films about royalty
title: The Forester's Daughter (1952 film)
